name: State_6

timeline_beats.label: Open-Seas Treaty; entry into Sea Trade Union/League

factions.label: Maritime Guild
factions.influence_hint: Controls long-distance trade, dominant in port councils

factions.label: Coastal Nobility
factions.influence_hint: Landed elites, hinterland levies and taxation

factions.label: Harbor Workers' Guild
factions.influence_hint: Labor force in ports; strikes disrupt trade

traits: merchant honor codes and contract literacy
practical syncretism of temple and clan rites

external_relations_refs.label_hint: Territorial Shifts after Great Naval War

constraints: No instant resurrection or true life-replacement magics
Long-range mind influence is rare and institutionally banned
Navigational auguries cannot replace charts and seamanship
Ritual magic requires scarce imported reagents or specialized labor
Combustion-derived industry limited (no high-pressure steam megatechs)
Must respect inter-state treaties and border settlements (T1, BC4)
Per coastal-map context: heavy dependence on maritime supply lines; vulnerable to blockade
notes: Major ports clustered around Harborhaven and Ironcliff; governance is port-centric
Relies on imported reagents; trade disruptions hit ritual functions and ship maintenance
Balanced power: guilds vs. temple orders vs. nobility; harbor labor adds instability
Key strategic chokepoints at Outer Atolls and Mireford channel
Naval capacity shaped policy since Great Naval War; diplomacy within A1/TB1 is central
